column12:
Reviews

250513

    Will pick up this week

Asana task: https://app.asana.com/1/6982134569842/project/1209395002920108/task/1210040565432264

Change Description

Modified Google Tag Manager (GTM-TGH83XK) configuration to only track successful page loads by setting Response Status conditions to only include "Success (200)" status codes. This change prevents Google Analytics from tracking 404 error pages, which was inflating error statistics.

Safety Considerations

    Low-risk configuration change that doesn't affect site functionality
    Only modifies analytics data collection, not user-facing content
    No impact on page loading times or server performance

Monitoring Plan

    Daily review of Google Analytics reports for 7 days post-change
    Compare to baseline report (SFZC_404_Baseline_Report_Pre-GTM-Fix_April2025.png)
    Verify 404 error percentage drops from ~82% to ~13-14%
column46:
'- No impact on site functionality or performance
- Will reduce the volume of data being processed by Google Analytics
- Improves accuracy of analytics reporting
- No changes to server-side code or Drupal core
column47:
'- No security impact
- Change only affects what data is sent to Google Analytics
- No modification to authentication or authorization systems
- No new external dependencies or connections
column48:
'- No special compliance requirements
- Change aligns with analytics best practices
- Reduces unnecessary data collection, which aligns with data minimization principles
- No personal or sensitive data handling changes
column49:
'- Implementation time: 10 minutes
- Testing and verification: 1 hour initially, plus 10 minutes daily for 7 days
- No additional server resources required
- No additional licensing costs
column50:
If issues occur, rollback process is simple:

Return to GTM settings (Configuration > System > Google Tag Manager)
Uncheck "Success (200)" or remove all response status conditions
Save configuration


Expected rollback time: Less than 5 minutes
No database or filesystem backups needed
column51:
'- Monitor Google Analytics Real-Time reports for 30 minutes after implementation
- Verify page views are still being tracked for normal site usage
- Compare total pageview counts before and after the change
- Create test 404 errors and confirm they are not tracked in GA

column5: SFZC.org/CMS/Google Tag module: Cookiebot/Gate config issues
column12:
REVIEWS

250325

    Research GT issues:
        COOKIEBOT
            Not fully configured to wrap tags based off of the Cookiebot banner
        GATE
            Not configured


----------------------------------------

ASSETS



Checking on Cookiebot

Dan Belsky
Mon, Mar 10, 12:54 PM (7 days ago)




to me

Hey Greg,

Happy Monday. In an effort to get our FB ads tracking working correctly, I've been working with a small firm, Community Boost, outsourced to us by Classy to assist (at no extra cost) with making sure our FB Ads Manager (FB Pixel) and Classy Conversions API are setup and tracking correctly. It's taken a few weeks but has gone well.

In the course of this work, last week on Friday, Community Boost saw something they thought I should bring up with you. They mentioned that our GTM is not fully configured to wrap tags based off of the Cookiebot banner...they mentioned something about our gate not being configured. I've attached some screenshots from our meeting that might be useful for reference. 

I'm not totally sure about the technical details beyond this, but wanted to mention it to you. I don't think this is a super-high priority since we've been operating with our current configuration for some time now. Just wanted to put this on your radar.

Thanks,
Dan

Name of person submitting event:
Anna Malo

Event Title:
Zen and Modern Leadership

Choose Category for the event:
Mindful Living

Format for this event:
3-night retreat 

Event Venue:
Tassajara - Large Retreat Hall

Account Designation:
42200-04-02 Hospitality: Onsite Teaching ZMC

Start Date:
Thursday, May 29, 2025

End Date:
Sunday, June 1, 2025

Start/End Times:
4pm-11am

Event Description:
Where personal growth in leaders creates empowering environments

In this immersive leadership retreat, we work toward deeper connection to self and others, using the Zen centric Leadership Embodiment management training program. Harnessing Zen, martial arts, mindfulness, and neuroscience research, learn to quickly and gracefully recover from stress, expand your capacity to stay poised and creative during conflict, and cultivate more comfort in difficult conversations. Discover how to leverage your body within 10 seconds to 2 minutes to shift from stress to strength+sensitivity, fostering ease, trust, creativity, and flourishing. Gain deep awareness and practical tools that transform how you show up and connect under pressure. This is a journey towards effective and purposeful leadership that cultivates an environment where everyone can thrive.


Teacher 1:
Sozan Michael McCord

Teacher 2:
Tierney Powers

Teacher 2 Bio:
Tierney Powers is an Integral Executive Coach and facilitator with over 15 years of experience in personal development. With a professional background in tech, spanning Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy, Customer Experience, Sales, and SaaS solution design, she brings a wealth of expertise from creating with stakeholders and leading teams in these corporate settings, as well passion from her own leadership journey.

Tierney's focal point is playfully nurturing leadership capabilities and facilitating practical, deep development. Her clientele includes C-level executives whom she coaches with this keen focus on fostering leadership skillfulness, with an emphasis on self awareness and creativity under stress. Proficient in methodologies like Conscious Leadership and neuroscience-based Leadership Embodiment, she has conducted extensive work both domestically and internationally, inspiring teams at institutions such as Stanford University and within the NBA, and actively seeks out opportunities to collaborate with leaders in the neuro-diverse and BIPOC communities.

Tierney's Integral approach and training, embraces whole person health: mindset, heart, relationship, and body (somatic). Armed with a Master's degree in Exercise Science, Tierney emphasizes the somatic aspect, enabling many executives to explore and unleash potential by tapping into the body. Her mission revolves around empowering individuals to take charge of their lives, relishing the journey toward becoming the finest version of themselves both personally and professionally.
